Name: To Orbit and Back Again: How the Space Shuttle Flew in Space (Springer Praxis Books / Space Exploration)

ReviewList.Text: If only this book existed 20 years ago! Scrap the history and the dreamy biographies - this tells you exactly what makes the STS work!

Holy cow, this will be on my nightstand for years!  Chock full of tech stuff.  I'm taking one point off because the relatively small format and B&W; images makes for some tough reading.  I'd love to see this in a really BIG book with color.
Excellent --- enough technical detail about the space shuttle to interest even the space enthusiast.  It's kind of an extended engineering paper about the shuttle.
